title: Celo Proposal to Migrate to Ethereum Layer 2 Passes - CoinDesk
summary: Celo, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform, has proposed to migrate to Ethereum's layer 2 solution, passing the proposal at Consensus 2024. This move aims to improve scalability and reduce transaction costs for the platform. Register and buy your pass now at consensus.coindesk.com to learn more about this and other industry developments.

title: Ethereum's 8th birthday: Crypto industry shares its top moments - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum celebrated its 8th birthday on July 30, 2023, with the crypto community sharing their fond memories and looking back at its growth since inception. The network has grown to become the second-largest crypto asset with a market capitalization of $225 billion and over 1,900 monthly active developers. Ethereum has reportedly secured $400 billion in value, generated $3.6 billion in annual profits, and has a total of 17.8 million blocks of digital assets. The network has been integral to the initial coin offering boom and the explosion of decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols. Ethereum has also successfully implemented the Merge upgrade, transitioning from a proof-of-work to a proof-of-stake consensus mechanism, reducing its energy usage and unlocking staking incentives for validators and investors.

title: Ethereum Price Analysis: Will Megaphone Pattern Trigger a New Recovery Cycle to $2200? - CoinGape

title: Ethereum Name Service (ENS): A Guide to .ETH Domains - Unchained
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum Name Service (ENS) is a decentralized naming system on the Ethereum blockchain that provides human-readable names for machine-readable addresses. It simplifies the user experience and makes the network more accessible, similar to Domain Name System (DNS).

ENS has three components: registry, resolver, and ENS name. The registry stores domain names and their corresponding Ethereum addresses, while the resolver updates domain names to Ethereum addresses. The ENS name is registered after a confirmation of the entry to the registry.

To get an ENS domain, you need a non-custodial Ethereum wallet and some ETH. The wallet should support ENS, and you need to pay for domain registration and transaction fees. The cost varies depending on the length of the domain name.

The steps to get an ENS domain are:

1. Connect your wallet to ENS
2. Search for your desired domain name
3. Purchase the domain name
4. Complete registration and set the resolver

title: EU's MiCA rules could prohibit MEV activities on Ethereum - crypto.news
summary: The EU's MiCA rules could prohibit MEV activities on Ethereum and other smart contract platforms. The Markets in Cryptoassets (MiCA) regulation, adopted by the European Parliament in April 2023, aims to prevent and prohibit market abuse involving crypto-assets. Article 92 of MiCA holds potential implications for MEV participants operating within the EU, as it could deem MEV to be illegal market abuse (transaction ordering). The regulation covers all transactions, orders, or behaviors related to any crypto-asset traded on exchanges, including those that occur on-chain. MEV, the practice of extracting the maximum value from block production by manipulating transaction order, is now under scrutiny due to MiCA. The regulation allows agencies to examine certain MEV practices that could be construed as market manipulation, mainly if they involve artificial price inflation or deceptive transactions. This could impact Crypto-Asset Service Providers (CASPs) and platforms, including exchanges approved to operate in the region, ensuring market liquidity for leading tokens while concurrently complying with the stringent MiCA requirements. The

title: Sorare is no longer an Ethereum-only platform — users can now pay with fiat - Blockworks
summary: Sorare, a fantasy sports platform, has expanded its payment options to include fiat currencies in addition to Ethereum. The move follows a partnership with Mangopay, a payments infrastructure provider. Users can now pay for games and digital cards in US dollars, euros, and pounds. The platform, which was founded in 2018, has attracted significant investment and now has a valuation of $4.3 billion. The CEO, Nicolas Julia, stressed that the platform remains blockchain-based but that the integration of fiat currencies enhances accessibility.

title: Ethereum’s Best Months Still Yet To Come, According to Crypto Analyst Benjamin Cowen – Here’s Why - The Daily Hodl
summary: Ethereum analyst Benjamin Cowen suggests that the best months to buy ETH are late Q4 or early Q1, based on historical data. He found that December and January have been the best months for ROI, while July was the worst. Cowen notes that there is clear seasonality associated with Ethereum, and investors who accumulate at the end of the year tend to perform better. As of writing, ETH is trading at $1,858.

title: How an Ethereum Bot Used Uniswap to Save $5.4 Million From Curve Exploit - Decrypt
summary: A decentralized trading bot used the Vyper programming language exploit in Curve Finance to save $5.4 million from an attack that stole $52 million from the platform. The bot, c0ffeebabe.eth, used flash loans and Uniswap to capitalize on the discrepancy in the price of Curve DAO (CRV) on Uniswap and Curve, and exchanged 70 Ethereum for over 190,000 CRV. The initial burst of CRV directed at Curve's CRV-ETH pool caused the Vyper bug to throw it out of balance, allowing the bot to exchange its remaining CRV for 2,949 Ethereum, 317 times what it would have otherwise been able to get without the exploit. The bot eventually parted with what would have been its biggest payday ever and returned the stolen funds to Curve.

title: Kraken Fixes Ethereum Funding Gateway Issues - Finance Magnates
summary: Kraken, a cryptocurrency exchange, has fixed an issue with its Ethereum funding gateway that was causing delays in deposits and withdrawals. The exchange did not provide details but announced the solution on its status page. Additionally, the exchange suspended trading on its futures platform for maintenance. The exchange's co-founder, Jesse Powell, is under investigation by federal law enforcement agencies for allegedly hacking a non-profit entity he founded. The IRS has also ordered the exchange to submit information related to historical transactions and users' accounts for an examination of underreported taxes.

title: Wombat Exchange's Ethereum Expansion: A New Burrow Begins August 4 - Crypto Briefing
summary: Wombat Exchange, a stableswap platform, is expanding to Ethereum on August 4, leveraging the network's liquidity and capitalizing on its success on BNB Chain and Arbitrum. The expansion will bring advanced functionalities such as minimal slippage, single-sided provisions, and rapid calculations to save on gas fees and time. Special rewards and incentives are planned for the launch week, and partnerships with leading protocols such as Lido are expected. The expansion aligns with Wombat's mission to build a premier multi-chain stableswap ecosystem, and the launch marks a significant moment in its growth.

title: SEC Required Coinbase to Trade Only Bitcoin, Exclude Ethereum and All Other Cryptos, Reports FT - Blockchain.News
summary: The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has requested that Coinbase cease trading all cryptocurrencies except Bitcoin, reports Financial Times. Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong revealed that the SEC believes all assets except Bitcoin are securities, but the regulatory body did not clarify how this conclusion was reached. The SEC has filed a lawsuit against Coinbase for failing to register as a broker and has identified 13 smaller cryptocurrencies traded on the platform as securities. The move could establish a precedent for other US crypto companies to operate outside legal boundaries unless registered with the SEC.

title: Ethereum is about to get crushed by liquid staking tokens - Cointelegraph
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum's native cryptocurrency, ETH, may soon be replaced by liquid staking tokens (LSTs) due to their advantages over traditional ETH. LSTs offer flexibility for tokenholders to engage in other activities across different networks while still earning ETH staking rewards. The cost to entry for LSTs is lower than regular ETH staking, making it appealing for reaching new audiences and smaller dollar investors. The transition to LSTs will come swiftly, but it's still early days, and LSTs have a much larger market potential than their current market share represents. The growth of LSTs could usher in an age where all ETH is staked through liquid staking protocols, and users will do all trading and other activities using LSTs. An LST takeover would be a positive thing for the industry, as it could attract new users and provide a new breath of life to the crypto industry.

title: Ethereum logs $1M MEV block reward amid Curve Finance exploit - Cointelegraph
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum experienced a significant MEV (maximal extractable value) block reward of $1M due to the exploit of Curve Finance stable pools on July 30. The MEV bot generated extra revenue by reordering and inserting transactions in the block to generate arbitrage opportunities. The validator received a cut of the revenue in exchange for allowing the MEV bot to front-run the transaction. The highest MEV bot block reward was 584.05 ETH, followed by 345 ETH and 247 ETH. The article raises moral questions about the use of potentially illicit funds to pay validators for front-running transactions.

title: Curve Exploit Results in Largest MEV Block Rewards in Ethereum's History - Unchained - Unchained
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

MEV bots on Ethereum have received large reward blocks for front running transactions in the mempool, with one bot receiving over $1 million. This is the largest MEV reward block in Ethereum's history. The rewards stem from exploits on Curve Finance's liquidity pools on Sunday. MEV bots pay block producers to move transactions up the line, earning them the rewards. While some question the morality of block producers keeping these funds, one MEV bot deployer has returned 2,879 ETH worth $5.3 million to the Curve deployer contract.

title: EIP-6968 Set To Enable Revenue Sharing For Ethereum - CryptoDaily
summary: Ethereum developers propose EIP-6968 to enable revenue sharing for dApp creators through a new token, "Contract Secured Revenue" (CSR). This token would allow developers to claim a percentage of transaction fees generated when users interact with their smart contracts. The proposal aims to incentivize developers to create and deploy dApps on Layer 2 (L2) networks, fostering innovation and community growth. The revenue generated could be used for funding dApp development, public goods, or incentivizing developers to join a network. EIP-6968 has gained attention following a presentation at the EthCC conference in Paris and could revolutionize the Ethereum scaling sector by introducing a novel incentive for developers.

title: CZ Says He Would Not Have Started Binance Had He Bought ETH Early - U.Today

He credits Ethereum with making ICOs possible, which in turn allowed Binance to be created. CZ also shares a rare photo with Vitalik Buterin, the co-founder of Ethereum, and mentions that he has known him since 2013. Meanwhile, Shiba Inu, a popular meme coin, is set to celebrate its birthday on July 31, 2023, after being created on the Ethereum chain in 2020.

title: BNB Smart Chain hit with copycat Vyper attack, $73K exploited - Cointelegraph
summary:
BNB Smart Chain hit with copycat Vyper attack, $73K exploited - Cointelegraph

A vulnerability in the Vyper programming language has led to copycat attacks on the BNB Smart Chain (BSC), resulting in the theft of around $73,000 worth of cryptocurrencies. The exploits follow a similar pattern to the one on the decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol Curve Finance, which has resulted in losses exceeding $41 million. The malfunctioning reentrancy lock on Vyper versions 0.2.15, 0.2.16, and 0.3.0 is believed to be the cause of the vulnerability. White hat and black hat hackers are currently duking it out on-chain, with one potential whitehat, c0ffebabe.eth, attempting to recover funds. Nearly 2,900 Ether worth over $5 million has been returned to Curve so far.

title: Layer-1 Blockchain Explained - LCX
summary: Layer-1 blockchains prioritize security, decentralization, and scalability, but the latter is a major limitation. Consensus mechanisms, sharding, and changing the consensus mechanism can improve scalability. Notable Layer-1 blockchains include Bitcoin, Ethereum, Polkadot, and Solana, each with unique features and use cases. Layer-1 protocols have the potential to underpin transformative applications and reshape the global economic and social landscape.

title: Eight Years of Ethereum: A Walk Down Memory Chain | Bitcoinist.com - Bitcoinist
summary:
Eight years ago, Ethereum was launched as a decentralized world computer with smart contract functionality, aiming to revolutionize the way we execute peer-to-peer agreements and applications. Since then, Ethereum has established itself as the leading smart contract platform, enabling a new wave of decentralized applications across various industries. Here are some key milestones in Ethereum's history:

1. Origins and launch (2013-2015): Ethereum was first proposed by Vitalik Buterin, and the non-profit Ethereum Foundation was created to oversee open-source development. The Genesis block launched in July 2015, with an initial Ether supply of 72 million coins and an initial price of $0.311 per ETH.
2. ICO boom (2017): Ethereum became the platform of choice for launching initial coin offerings (ICOs), with over $6 billion raised in 2017. However, the lack of regulation led to many sham offerings, and the ICO market partially collapsed.

title: Elon Musk Reveals 22-Year Plan to Transform X into World’s Most Valuable Financial Institution – Is Integration of Bitcoin, Dogecoin, XRP, and Ethereum Part of The Plan? - Crypto News Flash
summary: Elon Musk plans to transform Twitter into a comprehensive financial platform, potentially integrating cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, Dogecoin, XRP, and Ethereum. Musk has a 22-year plan to make Twitter the most valuable financial institution globally. Twitter has already obtained money transmitter licenses in some US states, indicating a commitment to building a robust payment infrastructure. While some may question the impact of integrating cryptocurrencies, Musk's massive following could drive broader adoption. The integration of digital assets could open up crypto transactions to a wider audience and facilitate the use of fintech and blockchain solutions. Twitter's previous partnership with Strike, a payments startup, hinted at its initial foray into cryptocurrencies. With Musk's vision and innovation, Twitter's transformation into a financial powerhouse seems increasingly plausible.

title: ERC-223 lands among the Ethereum standards - The Cryptonomist
summary: ERC-223, a new token standard proposed by Dexaran in 2017, has been added to Ethereum's official standards list. The standard aims to solve security and usability issues of the classic ERC-20 standard. It prevents users from accidentally sending tokens to contract addresses and simplifies the user experience by allowing assets to be sent via a single transfer function. Additionally, ERC-223 allows developers to manage incoming token transactions on contracts, reduces unnecessary gas fee spending, and makes transactions similar to those of Ether. The standard is backward compatible with ERC-20 tokens and can be converted 1:1 at any time without cost or restriction. Dexaran will publish tutorials and guidelines on how to work with ERC-223 tokens in the coming days.

title: How To Bridge Coins Back From Base To Ethereum: A Comprehensive Guide - Captain Altcoin
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

The Base chain allows users to withdraw ETH back to the Ethereum mainnet after a 7-day waiting period. This is done by visiting the L2StandardBridge contract and filling out the necessary fields, including the amount of ETH to withdraw and the transaction hash. The Optimism stack, which includes the Base chain, was designed with a built-in mechanism for bridging back from L2 to L1. A command-line tool written by the Base team can be used for withdrawals. Users can confirm that their proof went through by looking up the transaction hash on Etherscan, and they will have to wait 7 days before finalizing the withdrawal.
